page.title: 01Summary of the area.
page.content: This area mainly consists of the town of Bruton and the community of Redlynch. It is largely an industrial area, although there is a certain amount of light industry, which is based around the station. Recent proposals have included the development of various types of light industry, with the provision of small industrial units. Based in the town is a firm of agricultural hauliers, as well as a mill, which supplies agricultural food, fertilisers and seeds. This mill is called {Sheldon Jones.} Besides the actual shops of Bruton, a large amount of the area is taken-up with the buildings that comprise King's School. The river Brue runs through the area, which until recently was prone to serious flooding; the new dam should have stopped this.
